work.summary: Train corporate clients on-site/online in software development/methodologies
highlights: Instruct staff, principal, senior, and entry level engineers in modern tech stacks
Scope courses during sales calls, and develop course content
4.9/5 average course rating
Training topics: JavaScript, Java, Python, React(Redux/GraphQL/Relay/React-Native), Angular, Docker, TDD, and BDD
Clients: SalesForce, Intuit, Starbucks, IndianaUniversity, LibertyMutual

work.summary: Train students in full-stack JavaScript and Ruby. Develop internal CMS and Tools
highlights: First Instructor to teach the latest curriculum end to end
Spearheaded Corporate Training offerings
Instructed the inaugural course for the Portland campus
Training topics: JavaScript, Ruby, Data Structures, Algorithims, ExpressJs, React, Angular, Mongo, SQL, SASS, HTML, and CSS
Mentor and manage assistant instructors and teching assistants
Developed Ruby on Rails based CMS
Developed internal React based tool for charting net-promoter scores

work.summary: Evangelist, develop, and document the Shippable Continuous Integration platform
highlights: Primary author of the company blog blog.shippable.com
Blog achieved over 3,000 unique hits per month
Increased site traffic by over 300 precent
Regularly created sample code of new features at github.com/Shippablesamples
Finalize the design of public REST API
Documented public REST API

work.summary: SDE for the Amazon Web Services Elastic Beanstalk team
highlights: Created, tested, maintained, and deployed software to customers
Worked with all aspects of product: Development, QA, Testing, Deployment, Customer issues
Individually responsible for major features such as Java 7 Python 2.7, and Ruby 2.0 availability
Worked in a Unix development environment with several technology stacks (Java, PHP, Node.js, Python, and Ruby)
Sole Developer of the AWS Elastic Beanstalk Ruby 2 Puma container
Documented new product features and cross team work experience (worked full time with another team for one month)
Published writer for the AWS Application Management blog
Help with product direction for the Ruby/Rails container by researching community standards/development

work.summary: The aim of NETVUE is to design an intuitive realtime visualization system using a simple unified metaphor—the geographic map—to readily visualize network activity of interest.
highlights: Ported .NET networking system to the JVM via Scala
Implemented Quad tree data structure for network visualizations
Converted data structure library from C++ to C#

work.summary: Developed internal tools for the Aerospace division
highlights: Created a build tool to resolve and evaluate project dependencies
Created a Python based web scraping tool to export metrics into Excel sheets
Designed and maintained the company website
Provide miscellanious IT support
Create static and PHP based websites

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.
highlights: Awarded 'Teacher of the Month'

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
